title: U.S. college students average study hours , by major 2011
yAxis: Number of hours spent studying per week
summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
The difference of Number of hours spent studying per week between the highest and lowest Month is 12.9.
min_summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is appeared to be the highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
The difference of Number of hours spent studying per week between the highest and lowest Month is 12.9.
max_summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Number of hours spent studying per week 23.7 is found at Month Architecture and the minimum is found at Speech where Month is 10.8.
The Number of hours spent studying per week of Month Architecture is 2.19% larger than the minimum value at Speech.
The Month Architecture has the highest Number of hours spent studying per week, followed by Chemical Engineering, and Physics. Down to the Month Speech which is the lowest.
The Number of hours spent studying per week has reduced over the past 29 Months.
Month Theater, and Anthropology share the same value 16.0.
The average Number of hours spent studying per week in all 29 Months is 15.47.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 448.5.
